channel.title: Xloggin?
channel.description:
[quote="pure kirk, post:2, topic:337730"]yeh but you need to advertise your server random people aren't gonna pop up btw you should fix xlogging[/quote]
I have no clue what hes talking about i jsut asked if my server was online if i got on no-ip and my local if my server was up and he says i needa fix my xloggin what LOL?

item.title: Xloggin?
item.dc:creator: @Natey Natey
item.description:
@Natey wrote:

Find the logout code and the in-combat code.

Read full topic

item.title: Xloggin?
item.dc:creator: @Daem Daem
item.description:
@Daem wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:4, topic:337806”][quote author=The Disciple link=topic=434207.msg3188216#msg3188216 date=1271980345]
Xlogging is when someone closes out of the client using the “X” button. This is usually done when someone is fighting a tough monster or pking. When they’re about to die, they’ll xlog out and when they log back in, they’ll keep all their stuff.
[/quote]

Also some people end the process to get past the log out button, to fix that you need to make it so when a player does log out in combat it will keep their player logged in for a curtain amount of time, most likely 10-20 seconds.[/quote]

how so

Read full topic

item.title: Xloggin?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

The Disciple:

Xlogging is when someone closes out of the client using the “X” button. This is usually done when someone is fighting a tough monster or pking. When they’re about to die, they’ll xlog out and when they log back in, they’ll keep all their stuff.

Also some people end the process to get past the log out button, to fix that you need to make it so when a player does log out in combat it will keep their player logged in for a curtain amount of time, most likely 10-20 seconds.

Read full topic
